org.webchecker.login

Class Login

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.webchecker.login.Login

  • public final class Login
extends java.lang.Object
    Module for logging to a website. Also provide automatic checking for logged and auto logging.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matěj Kripner, Jindřich Máca (Tuník), Ondřej Štorc <o.storc@outlook.com>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Login.NotPreparedException
      Exception, that should be thrown when a module was not prepared, but it's method was called.

      Getter for login form which is given to instance by method prepare(org.webchecker.forms.Form, org.webchecker.State).

      Test, if we are logged (the state object is in logged state).

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Login getInstance()
        Getter for singleton instance - return an instance of Login singleton.
        Returns:
        instance of Login singleton

      • prepare

        public void prepare(@NotNull
                    Form loginForm,
                    State state)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Prepare the instance of Login class to use. If the instance is already prepared, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        loginForm - filled with data and ready for send, has to be not-null
        state - object containing information about current state (cookies, etc.). If null, blank state is used
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if loginForm argument is null

      • unprepare

        public void unprepare()
               throws Login.NotPreparedException
        Unprepare the instance of Login class.
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • login

        public org.jsoup.Connection.Response login()
                                    throws Login.NotPreparedException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        Attempts to log in (in fact, send the login form) and update the state of object.
        Returns:
        response for sent login form
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared
        java.io.IOException - if sending of the form fails

      • logged

        public boolean logged(java.util.function.Predicate<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> isLogged)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      Login.NotPreparedException
        Test, if we are logged (the state object is in logged state).
        Parameters:
        isLogged - function has to determine, if we are logged, depending on response's cookies
        Returns:
        true if we are logged, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something get wrong with connection and/or response
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • getLoginForm

        public Form getLoginForm()
                  throws Login.NotPreparedException
        Getter for login form which is given to instance by method prepare(org.webchecker.forms.Form, org.webchecker.State).
        Returns:
        currently set login form
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • startLogging

        public void startLogging(java.lang.Long seconds,
                         java.util.function.Predicate<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> isLogged)
                  throws Login.NotPreparedException
        Method is used for starting automatic login. Always a given time period, the method tries to log on.
        Parameters:
        seconds - indicate for how long the method attempt to log in again in seconds
        isLogged - Predicate if user is logged
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • stopLogging

        public void stopLogging()
                 throws Login.NotPreparedException
        Disable auto logging.
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • getCurrentState

        public State getCurrentState()
                      throws Login.NotPreparedException
        Return current state.
        Returns:
        current state
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • autoLogging

        public boolean autoLogging()
                    throws Login.NotPreparedException
        Test, if the auto logging is on.
        Returns:
        the auto logging is on
        Throws:
        Login.NotPreparedException - if the instance is not prepared

      • prepared

        public boolean prepared()
        Determine, if the login instance is prepared for use.
        Returns:
        {code true}, if the Login module is prepared, false otherwise
